availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Frankfort, Kentucky, soldier. Frankfort native. Son of John J. Crittenden and Maria Knox Innes Crittenden. Clerk in Frankfort in 1850. Captain in the 4th U.S. Cavalry Regiment from August 1861 to March 1863. Promoted to colonel on March 20, 1863. Colonel of the 12th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment from April 1863 to August 1865.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District No. 1. Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 302. Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0115. Roger D. Hall, Colonels in Blue-Indiana, Kentucky and Tennessee (Jefferson, N.C.: McFarland, 2014), 152. Find A Grave, "Eugene Wilkinson Crittenden (1832-1873)," Memorial #60333528, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/60333528/eugene-wilkinson-crittenden (accessed January 18, 2018).
